body_content.explanation: in a prison, a form of punishment in which someone is kept in a room alone:
examples: On one occasion, when he was new to intensive management, he assaulted a guard who was trying to handcuff him.
Intensive management inmates do not have access to anything that could be damaging.

body_content.explanation: the part of a prison where these rooms are found:
examples: The Intensive Management Unit operates as a rigidly controlled mini-prison within the prison.
He has been in Intensive Management for 35 months because he has been a "disciplinary problem".
